general.newElement: Click here to add a new element
general.deleteElement: Do you want to delete this element?

tooltips.mediaFileExtensions: For multiple extensions use comma separation: `zip,rar,psd,docx`. You need to whitelist all file extensions in the Form Builder plugin configuration also.
tooltips.useSassCompiler: Enables SASS Compiler, you don't need to declare the form ID
tooltips.bootstrapWideSpacing: Use more space beetween the elements
tooltips.width: What width (x/12) should the element have in the viewport `{viewport}`?
tooltips.cssId: Use this to identify the element for JavaScript functions
tooltips.dateMin: You can use `today`, `+x days`, `+x months` or `-x days` to generate a limitation for this field. Leave empty for no limitation.
tooltips.dateMax: You can use `today`, `+x days`, `+x months` or `-x days` to generate a limitation for this field. Leave empty for no limitation.
tooltips.tooltip: Declare more information as a tooltip
tooltips.defaultValue: If you want to prefill this element, you can do this here. Use semicolon separation and the technical names if you want to prefill checkbox groups. For example: `option1;option2;option3`. Another special feature is to use Twig variables, use `{{context.customer.email}}` to prefill the mail address if the customer is logged in.
tooltips.usePriceCalculation: For type: Extend add to cart. You can redefine your product`s price with this option
tooltips.submitText: Use any text snippet for the label of the submit button
tooltips.useCustomTemplate: Write your own custom Template for this form element
tooltips.useCustomFields: Enable up to three translateable custom fields for additional descriptions etc
tooltips.redirectParams: Some redirects require special parameters, some of them can be obtained directly from the form input using the technical names
tooltips.action: This value is important for events and Twig template snippets. This value has to be unique.
tooltips.useImageSelection: You are able to use images as checkbox or radio-groups. Simply from your Media
tooltips.isEntitySelect: Use any values and labels from Shopware. For custom filters you can subscribe the `FormOptionCriteriaEvent`.
tooltips.pseudo: This element is not output in the DOM, it only serves as a technical placeholder to use your own fields in the HTML element.
tooltips.mapping: Tell us where this customer input have to be saved. Every entity has different properties, but all of them are using `customFields`
tooltips.redirectTo: Empty: Refresh Page. Relative Path (/my-path/): Redirect to a Shop Page. Absolute Path (https://google.de): Redirect to Google. Controller Path (frontend.home.page): Redirect to an internal Shopware Page.
tooltips.successMessage: Your customer see this feedback message if the form is valid and sent
tooltips.mediaFolderId: Tell us where to store the customer uploaded media. Actually its not possible to set this media as attachment to any contact form.
tooltips.maxFileSize: If you use e-mail transfer we recommend 10MB or 20MB
tooltips.mediaType: Go to the plugin configuration to enable the file types (e.g. zip, rar etc)
tooltips.type: Field of application of the created form. The form can be used in different variations, for example as a contact form or as additional fields for customer registration.
tooltips.mediaFolder: In which media folder should the uploaded files be saved?
tooltips.emailReceiver: List of e-mail recipients of this form. Separate multiple e-mail recipients with semicolon or leave empty if e-mail recipient is default.
tooltips.insertDatabase: Offers the possibility to save user entries directly in the database. This option is planned for later versions.
tooltips.bootstrapGrid: Bootstrap with a grid of 12 columns is used for the form layout.
tooltips.relatedEntity: Relevant for database overwrite: In the element settings, you can define any fields for the database entry. For example, you can offer a customer to enter his customer number himself.
tooltips.productRelations: This form is only active for selected products. To do so, go to the plugin configuration of your add-on and change the use case to `Activate for chosen products`.
tooltips.isValid: This is a control field for multiple choice queries
tooltips.isUnique: This field may only contain the value entered by the user once. An error message will be issued if there are duplicate entries.
tooltips.technicalName: This field is for technical purpose and need to be set. No spaces, no special characters and no umlauts may be used. Make sure that you use every name just once in your form.
tooltips.hasEmailReceiver: Specify your options with additional e-mail receivers. If an option is selected, the additional e-mail receiver will be informed.
tooltips.repeaterOpen: Warning: This element is experimental, for experts use and not officially supported. Use this element if you want to repeat input fields multiple times. Do not forget to set Repeater Close.

properties.noWrap: No parent HTML tags / No wrap
properties.name: Name
properties.label: Label

placeholder.successMessage: Your request has been send, thank you.
